comments:
Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20060131-1200

In self-hosting dev3.2 workspace (with jdt/core projects as source, rest as imported binary plugins). I no longer am able to run the exportplugin script located in org.eclipse.jdt.core/scripts/exportplugin.xml

It ran fine until the day before I upgraded to this I-build.
Note: I also often run in parallel a dev3.1 workspace, using the same installed SDK. This was the case when I discovered the issue.

I started the dev3.2 workspace before the dev3.1, and when intending to run the script from dev3.2 workspace, it rang the bell and aborted. But same script would run just fine in dev3.1 workspace.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ant.ui 4 120 2006-02-02 22:54:37.980

org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.antsupport.inputhandler.ProxyInputHandler -buildfile \"D:\eclipse\workspaces\dev3.2\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core\scripts\exportplugin.xml\"

in UserEntries: Ant Home  and Additional Tasks Support
tried to restore default entries.
no luck
checked that d:\eclipse\sdk\eclipse\plugins\org.apache.ant still existed on disk (org.apache.ant_1.6.5)

D:\eclipse\sdk\eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.osgi\bundles\17\1\.cp\lib\remoteAnt.jar 

no longer exists however

Also I noticed after migrating to latest I-build. I did forget to reimport all binary plugins. 
After reimporting, the script would run again.

Later. After exiting/restarting dev3.1 workspace. The script would not run again in dev3.2 workspace.

Tried to reimport binary plugins. No effect.

I exited Eclipse. Cleaned the entire configuration folder. It wouldn't restart at all.

I restored (offending) configuration folder, but cleaned osgi/bundles folder. I restarted dev3.2 workspace. script now works again !!!

CCing Pascal as Ant is just a consumer. I do not believe we could be causing this problem but I am open to suggestions on what is occuring here and how if anything to do with the osgi support or any known issues?

There is not enough details to figure out what is going on here. I got the build created a new workspace, loaded jdt.core and exported succesfully.

Darin, when / how often do you compute the classpath value?

See org.eclipse.ant.core.AntCorePreferences.computeDefaultExtraClasspathEntries(List entries) would the place where something like
   URL url = Platform.asLocalURL(bundle.getEntry(library));
is returning the outdated url.

This is recalculated on each startup of Eclipse.

I checked 3.2M5, and problem is still there.
Launching dev3.1 wks while dev3.2 wks is used is causing the problem to appear.
Workaround is to exit/restart dev3.2 wks...

Pascal: note that I am running the following Ant script:    
     org.eclipse.jdt.core\scripts\exportplugin.xml\


If you need my workspace, I can give it to you (it is big however)
Moving to Equinox
Moving to PDE->Build.

I experienced the same problem on M6 with a workspace that I recently created with M6. 

This is extremly confusing as I - the enduser - don't have a clue what is happening. I tried to export a deployable feature and what I got is an internal ant problem. From that point on PDE is broken. I - the enduser - don't have any hint how to work around the problem. As PDE stopped working, I - the plug-in developer - are set on hold. 

Bumping up severity.

I do not believe this is a PDE build bug. 
I believe something is going bad in the resolution of Bundle.getEntry(String) for the determination of the extra classpath entries for the Ant runtime classpath.
I think this problem has been reported before and we could not reproduce. I would be very interested in getting steps to reproduce this.

I don't have steps that reproduce the problem. I haven't dealt that workspace  in any special way. I created the workspace and imported plug-ins as binary plug-ins. Additionally, I added plug-ins and features from a repository. I exported multiple features. Everything worked fine. I closed the workspace and re-opened it again later. When trying to export a feature the problem showed up. I am sure there weren't more steps involved, as I the only thing I did at that time was setting up features.

Can you list the plugins you imported as binary and which ones you checked out as source from CVS?  Also did you install any additional bundles into your development environment, or is it just base eclipse SDK?
We have not be able to reproduce this issue.  Is this still a problem in 3.3 M6?

Have not seen it in a long time (it was opened against 3.2...).
Fine to close for me.

Closing as works for me.  Please reopen if this is seen on 3.3 M6 or later,
thanks.
